column4: evening all i am trying to install freenx client and i keep getting this:  $/usr/NX/bin/nxclient &
bash: $/usr/NX/bin/nxclient: No such file or directory
[1]    Exit 127                $/usr/NX/bin/nxclient
anyone know how to fix this
sorry
whats wrong?
i wasn't in room

no such file or directory
how did you install the NX client?
link?
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/FreeNX
sudo ls -l /usr/NX/bin
i got " nxclient, mxesd,nxprint,mxssh
will you pastebin it i want to see permissions/owner/group stuff
how do i do that
how did you know the 4 files.. i want to see all the output for the files
did you put the -l in there thats a dash L
but lowercase L
ok i will try again sorry
np .... -l is for long format.. it shows more info
" ls: user/NX/bin: No such file or directory"

how about a "sudo -l /usr/NX" and then a "sudo -l /usr"

ha 1 sec

ooohh ok.. are you trying to use sudo to start the client?
start the client
when you where trying to type /usr/NX/bin/nxclient & where you putting sudo in front of it?
i didnt realize i only needed the client on here and i installed the rest on the machine i am trying to control
yes
i tyoed "$sudo apt-get install nxclient" to install and then "$/usr/NX/bin/nxclient &" to start it
but it says it cant find it in /bin
can't find /bin when you do what?
http://pastebin.ca/30500
ok you don't have to type $
you know your currently root.. there is no need to be root.. be your normal user sean
so get rid of $ for starting or when i installed
either.. you don't need to put a $ in front.. that means as a normal user.. where as # is the prompt when your root
so i should install again and then execute again
do you see how your currently root@Sean ???  you should be root unless you are doing something very specific
err should NOT be root (typo)
ok how do i change that (sorry and thanks)
np.. did you at soem point do a "sudo su"?
dont htink so
how did you open your terminal?
with a shortkut i made on my desktop
do you know what that shortcut points to?
cant remeber
bad typer sorry
apps, system tools, root terminal
it isn't a problem. it appears that the shortcut creates a terminal as root the super user.. i would suggest using the terminal in Applications-Accessories-Terminal
and restarting the whole gat apt
that is the super user one.. with that one if not careful. you can mess your system up. its like typing sudo in front of every command
thanks for your help i will try that
i'd close that window and open up a normal on from the accessories window
then i have a couple thigns for you to try.. we will fix the permissions on the fiels .. and then hopefully get the application to start
k ready
sudo chown -R root /usr/NX
k got sean@sean
good.. now try the command "sudo chown -R root /usr/NX" if you haven't yet
k did that
sudo chgrp -R root /usr/NX
y
no not that 1 sec
k done
ls -l /usr and then "ls -l /usr/NX" and then "ls -l /usr/NX/bin" and paste then to the pastebin
1 sec

next time a lower case L is in order.. but since youc an see it.. it must have worked..
now try trying "/usr/NX/bin/nxclient"

and a program shoudl start

and the name would be whatever you want to call it
